depression.translation[0].definitions[0]: a medical condition that makes you very unhappy and anxious and often prevents you from living a normal life
women who suffer from post-natal depression (=that sometimes happens after the birth of a baby)
depression.translation[0].definitions[1]: a feeling of sadness that makes you think there is no hope for the future
Lucyâ€™s mood was one of deep depression.
depression.translation[0].definitions[2]: a long period during which there is very little business activity and a lot of people do not have jobs
the devastating effects of economic depression
depression.translation[0].definitions[3]: a part of a surface that is lower than the other parts
depression.translation[0].definitions[4]: a mass of air under low pressure, that usually causes rain
depression.translation[1].definitions[0]: a long period of time during which there is very little business activity and a lot of people do not have jobs
The current economic depression can be turned around if companies can be persuaded to invest in the industry.
The nation as a whole was suffering from a period of deep depression following a boom which had peaked six or seven years before.
depression.translation[1].definitions[1]: the period from 1929 to 1934 during which economic activity was very low and unemployment reached very high levels in the US and Europe
The American silk market collapsed in 1929/30 following the onset of the Great Depression.
Commodity prices were at their lowest since the Great Depression.
